reviews.review_msg: One of the best profs at SFU! She is caring, accessible and an excellent lecturer. She has a bunch of different assignments (writing assignments, group work, reading comprehension and a final) and obviously cares a lot about her field and her students. There is a lot of reading but, if you put in the work, you learn a lot and will do well.

She's a legend for a reason! I enjoyed the format of her class; it helped me better understand the concepts that were introduced to us. Make sure to keep up with the readings as there are a lot of articles to read, but they were manageable. Your grades for papers are highly dependent on the TAs, which can make or break your grade in this class.
